short_summary: The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires a qualified enterprise to provide expertise inspection services for medical equipment at federal correctional facilities in the Atlantic region (Nova Scotia and New Brunswick). The contractor must perform annual inspections during core business hours and provide a detailed report of all inspected equipment within 30 days.
description: This requirement is for the Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) to provide medical device maintenance program (MDMP) services. The MDMP ensures that medical devices and equipment are safe and functional. It also provides guidance to identify and address potential problems with medical devices and equipment that may result in injury to staff or patients. The contractor must provide expertise inspection services for medical equipment listed in the annexes C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K. The contractor must test equipment that undergoes inspection to ensure it meets quality control standards as per the manufacturer's guidelines. The contractor must perform annual performance testing, inspection and calibration of electro medical devices in order to comply with standards set forth by the respective provinces. The contractor must assist in identifying requirements with regards to replacing existing equipment or purchasing new equipment. The contractor must repair all issues or problems with equipment being inspected that does not require any parts. The report must be provided in writing to the managers, health care and rehabilitation program and services at each site, chief of health services at regional hospital and shepody healing center, regional pharmacist, regional clinical practice lead nursing at RHQ and copy must also be sent to the project authority at RHQ within 30 days of the site inspection. The report must detail all pieces of equipment inspected, any concerns identified and/or repairs recommended (i.e., part #, etc.) and/or completed. The report must also indicate date of visit and list items either in alphabetical order or in order of equipment code. The contractor must perform the inspections during the CSC's core business hours of monday to friday from 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. The contractor must travel to the site of the different Federal correctional facilities in the Atlantic region. The contractor must provide the services for a period of August 1, 2023 to July 31, 2024 with the option to renew for four (4) additional one-year periods. The contract awarded to the contractor shall be according to the terms and conditions of the Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP).

# Medical Device Maintenance Program
## Solicitation Number: 21201-23-4319384
### Reference Number: cb-4209-70463866
### Tender Closing Date: April 20, 2023 13:00:00

The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is soliciting proposals from qualified contractors to provide expert inspection services for medical devices located at federal correctional facilities in the Atlantic Region (Nova Scotia and New Brunswick).

### Objective
The objective of this requirement is to identify and address potential problems with medical devices and equipment that may result in injury to staff or patients.

### Inspection Services
The contractor must provide annual on-site inspections of medical equipment located at CSC facilities, including electro-medical devices. The contractor must conduct industry-standard verifications for each piece of equipment and test the equipment to ensure it meets quality control standards.

### Inspection Schedule
Inspectors must perform the inspections during CSC's core business hours (Monday to Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.). Due to the nature of the environment, the scheduled dates of inspections and repairs may be subject to change.

### Travel and Living Expenses
The contractor's prices must include all vehicle transportation, tools, equipment, consumables, permits, insurances, supervision, and return travel time to provide the required services.

### Contract Duration
The period of the contract is 5 years, from August 1, 2023, to July 31, 2028, with an option to renew for 4 additional 1-year periods.

Hurry up! Bidders can obtain the complete solicitation document and associated documents from Buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders. The Crown reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

**
**Our Business Requirements are:
* The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) requires expert inspection services for medical devices located at federal correctional facilities in the Atlantic Region (Nova Scotia and New Brunswick).
* The inspection services will ensure that medical devices and equipment are safe and functional.
*
###Our Contracting Requirements are:
* Estimated Quantity: see solicitation document statement of work and basis of payment.
* Contract Duration: The period of the contract is 5 years, from August 1, 2023, to July 31, 2028.
* Trade Agreements: this contract is subject to various trade agreements, including Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), World Trade Organisation-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), etc
